titles.title: To ensure the protection of the coastal marine coral environment off the west coast of Puerto Rico by requiring the Director of the United States Geological Service to assess the environmental economic costs and benefits of relocating an existing wastewater treatment plant outfall to a deepwater location, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Resources, and in addition to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to House Transportation and Infrastructure
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Mineral Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries, Wildlife and Oceans.
Executive Comment Requested from Interior, Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment.

bill.summary: 3/30/1995--Introduced. Requires the Director of the Geological Survey to study and map the marine environment of Anasco Bay, Puerto Rico, and the surrounding ocean area, to determine the feasibility of constructing a deepwater outfall for the treatment works at Mayaguez, Puerto Rico. Authorizes appropriations.
